New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run home run in his first-ever playoff game
Key Match Events: The Dodgers pushed in front in the fourth inning on a two-run single from Teoscar Hernandez and never trailed again
Five Dodgers relievers held the Padres scoreless over the final six innings in a 7-5 victory
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers will send right-hander Jack Flaherty to the mound in Game 2
Former Dodgers right-hander Yu Darvish will take the mound for the Padres
Darvish is 5-5 with a 2.27 ERA in 15 career starts against the Dodgers, including 1-0 with a 1.72 ERA in three starts this season
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said 'I talked about this for a few weeks that we need to fight, and that's what we did'
The Padres' Fernando Tatis Jr. said 'They're coming alive, so we better outscore them, Find a way to make it happen no matter what and go from there'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres took an early lead with a three-run first inning that included a two-run home run from Manny Machado
The Padres led 5-3 in the third inning after a two-run double from Xander Bogaerts
Others: The Dodgers ended a six-game postseason losing streak
